intro: Cyrtandra agusanensis, commonly known as the Agusan cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
